Posts.EditableText:
[b:jojf6olh]IF Classics[/b:jojf6olh] now also develops in Ren’Py to support graphics.  On our website ([url:jojf6olh]http://ifclassics.weebly.com/[/url:jojf6olh]), you can download these new releases:

[i:jojf6olh]Little Lord Fauntleroy[/i:jojf6olh]
What happens when the complete public-domain text of this children’s classic meets the public-domain film?  You’ll see in our visual novel.
[Remember, when necessary, to use the “Hide” command in the Quick Menu at the bottom of every screen.]

[i:jojf6olh]Selected Aesop’s Fables[/i:jojf6olh]
Quaint retelling of five basic truths about life.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[b:jojf6olh]IF Classics[/b:jojf6olh]
[i:jojf6olh]We focus on converting classical literature into interactive format[/i:jojf6olh]

Posts.EditableText: I keep meaning to try these out so cheers for the link. Not sure I'd be happy downloading an .exe though.
Posts.HTML: I keep meaning to try these out so cheers for the link. Not sure I'd be happy downloading an .exe though.

Posts.EditableText:
[quote="Silver":uelkrt1i]I keep meaning to try these out so cheers for the link. Not sure I'd be happy downloading an .exe though.[/quote:uelkrt1i]
Thanks for your reply.

I don't really understand your reservation about downloading an ".exe".  The .exe file is contained within a .zip file, and the .zip file as well as the .exe file were produced directly from the Ren'Py "Build Distributions" command.

Every "compiled" program that we download on the Internet contains an .exe file in its distribution package.
